definition: in Qing dynasty, Manchurian word for wife
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to move forward/to promote/to advance

sentences.english: The third interpretation attributes the practice to Fu Jin, the Princes of Gong of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第三種解釋跟清朝的恭親王福晉有關。

sentences.english: I see, the taste of blessing Jin wears this equitable affirmative accommodation best.
sentences.chinese: 我看，福晉的眼光極好，穿這個正正合適。

sentences.english: Quick bearer cures a wood to seek also many to see because eight blessing Jin.
sentences.chinese: 快來人，把林太醫找來給八福晉看看。

sentences.english: How to hear to eight congratulating Jins in an interesting condition not happy?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼聽八福晉有喜了就不高興了呢？

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to play deaf-mute
to settle a marriage/betrothal
high and mighty (idiom); arrogant
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to be a yes-man
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to punish
slow/sluggish/lazily/to slow down
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to mediate/to broker a compromise
to shiver
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
